intro: Gilia glomeriflora, commonly known as the clustered gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Gilia glomeriflora is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun.
